lead: Education is evolving rapidly in response to technological advancements, societal needs, and the legacy of influential figures in the field. This brief explores recent developments and historical contributions that shape the landscape of education today.

stories.title: Last rites for perpetual enterprise software licenses?
stories.summary: The shift from perpetual enterprise software licenses to cloud-based SaaS models is reshaping the educational technology landscape. As organizations face the end of availability for legacy software, the need for modern solutions that enhance cybersecurity and functionality becomes critical. This transition reflects broader trends in education where technology must adapt to meet evolving demands and improve operational efficiency.

stories.title: Dr. Gladys West, whose mathematical models inspired GPS, dies at 95
stories.summary: Dr. Gladys West, a pioneering mathematician whose work laid the foundation for GPS technology, has passed away. Her contributions highlight the importance of representation in STEM fields, especially for women of color. West's story serves as an inspiration for future generations in education, emphasizing the need for diverse role models in mathematics and technology.

stories.title: He called himself an ‘untouchable hacker god’. But who was behind the biggest crime Finland has ever known?
stories.summary: The Vastaamo hack in Finland exposed sensitive therapy notes of thousands, raising serious concerns about data security in educational settings. This incident underscores the vulnerabilities that educational institutions face in protecting personal information, especially as they increasingly rely on digital platforms for mental health services and student records.

stories.title: Elon Musk’s stubborn spin on Grok’s sexualized images controversy
stories.summary: Elon Musk's recent comments on AI tools and their implications for education highlight the ongoing debate about technology's role in learning environments. The proposed California tax aimed at funding education and social services also reflects the growing intersection of technology, policy, and educational funding, prompting discussions about equitable access to resources.
